data.title: Critical – Hana Ga Saita Yo
data.meta_description: Posts about Critical written by Vieilocean
data.text:
Dead Dead Demon's Dededestruction (Japanese: デッドデッドデーモンズデデデデデストラクション, Hepburn: Deddo Dēmonzu Dededede Desutorakushon), often abbreviated as DDDD, is a manga written and drawn by Asano Inio.Initially published in chapters in Big Comic Spirits magazine from April 28, 2014 until February 28, 2022, and eventually collected into 12 tankobon volumes.The serialization of DDDD lasted for nearly eight years,…

Ghost Hound (神霊狩/GHOST HOUND, Shinreigari/Gōsuto Haundo) is an animated series first broadcast in Japan between 18 October 2007 and 03 April 2008 on the WOWOW satellite channel, created by Production I.G to commemorate the studio's 20th year in the field of animation. Given the importance of the project, Production I.G assembled a first-class staff. The…

Yūsha-tachi (勇者たち, Heroes) is a manga written and drawn by Inio Asano (浅野 いにお ; Namegata, 22 September 1980). Released in chapters between 6 March 2015 and 17 October 2018, first on Hibana magazine, and later on the MangaONE app, both owned by Shogakukan Co. Ltd publishing house, and finally collected and published in a…

Serial Experiments Lain (SEL) is a Japanese animated series, consisting of thirteen episodes, broadcast for the first time in Japan in July 1998 on TV Tokyo, in the late night. The success achieved over the years has made it a cult of Japanese animation. SEL is the brainchild of Yasuyuki Ueda (上田 耕行), producer at…

Bokurano (ぼ く ら の Bokura no, literally "Ours") is a manga written and drawn by Mohiro Kitoh (鬼頭 莫 宏, Kitō Mohiro; 8 August 1966). Consisting of 65 chapters, it was first published on the monthly magazine Ikki between November 25, 2003 and June 25, 2009, and subsequently collected in eleven tankobons (volumes) by…

Reiraku (零落) is a manga written and illustrated by Inio Asano (浅 野 い に お; Namegata, 22 September 1980). Published in chapters between 10 March 2017 and 28 July of the same year on the Big Comic Superior magazine, and subsequently collected in a single volume (tankobon). Asano wrote Reiraku in the midst of…

Devilman Crybaby is an animated series created specifically to celebrate the fifty years of career of one of the personalities who has contributed most to the development of anime and manga culture, both within national borders and in its export all over the world: Go Nagai. Produced by the collaboration between Aniplex Inc., Dynamic Planning…

The City of Light (ひ か り の ま ち Hikari no Machi) is a manga by Inio Asano (浅 野 い に お; Namegata, 22 September 1980), consisting of nine chapters published in the Weekly Young Sunday magazine between 19 April 2004 and 19 January of 2005, and subsequently collected in a single volume/tankobon…

Published between April and July 2008, Kaiba is the second original work written and directed by Masaaki Yuasa (湯 浅 政 明, born in Fukuoka on March 16, 1965), famous to the public for being the director of Devilman Crybaby and The Tatami Galaxy . As in all the works of Yuasa, also in Kaiba…

Boogiepop Phantom (ブギーポップは笑わない Bugīpoppu wa Warawanai Boogiepop Phantom, literally "Boogiepop Never Laughs: Boogiepop Phantom") is a twelve-episode anime television series by Kouhei Kadono (上遠野 浩平Kadono Kōhei, born December 12, 1968) published in January 2000,part of a larger work. The Boogiepop-verse has kept expanding its contents, with more than twenty light novels to its credits, two mangas, one…

The contents on the site can be copied only for comparison and research purposes, citing the author and linking the source.

I contenuti presenti sul sito possono essere copiati solo a scopo di confronto e ricerca, citando l’autore e linkando la fonte.
